text: The Prime Minister of the Cook Islands is the head of government of the Cook Islands, a self-governing territory in free association with New Zealand. The office was created in 1965, when self-government was first granted to the islands. ==List== No. Name Tenure Tenure Political affiliation Political affiliation No. Name Took office Left office Political affiliation Political affiliation 1 Albert Henry 4 August 1965 25 July 1978 Cook Islands Party 2 Tom Davis 25 July 1978 13 April 1983 Democratic Party 3 Geoffrey Henry 13 April 1983 16 November 1983 Cook Islands Party Tom Davis 16 November 1983 29 July 1987 Democratic Party 4 Pupuke Robati 29 July 1987 1 February 1989 Democratic Party Geoffrey Henry 1 February 1989 29 July 1999 Cook Islands Party 5 Joe Williams 29 July 1999 18 November 1999 Cook Islands Party 6 Terepai Maoate 18 November 1999 11 February 2002 Democratic Alliance Party 7 Robert Woonton 11 February 2002 11 December 2004 Democratic Alliance Party 8 Jim Marurai 14 December 2004 29 November 2010 Democratic Alliance Party (2004–05) Cook Islands First Party (2005–06) Democratic Party (2006–2010) 9 Henry Puna 30 November 2010 1 October 2020 Cook Islands Party 10 Mark Brown 1 October 2020 Incumbent Cook Islands Party ==Other websites== *World Statesmen – Cook Islands
title: Prime Minister of the Cook Islands
